website_summaries.verdict: A monster lock that will deter even the most prepared and creative thieves. If you want your bike to be 100% safe, this is your best bet.
pros: Kryptonite will even replace up to $3000 of your bike if it gets stolen when using this lock
cons: Heavy weight makes it difficult to carry around
Lock tumblers get “finicky” after a few weeks of daily use, making it a struggle to lock and unlock

customer_reviews.title: Not heavy duty enough. I parked my bike outside ...
customer_reviews.text: Not heavy duty enough. I parked my bike outside of my school for about 45 minutes. I chained it around a light pole.when I was walking back to get my bike , I saw this pice of sh#t of human being right next to my bike cutting the lock using a hand saw. Luckily i didn't take to long dealing with my financial aid and I was able to get back to my bike sooner than expected. If I have taken 5 minutes longer I wouldn't find my bike.
customer_reviews.author: jeffrey silva

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive advertising
customer_reviews.text: Just got this and read the documents. I went into this knowing the insurance would be mostly useless. I was right. First: the $3,750 is actually $2,000. Second: It’s only free for a year. Third: It’s only applied to the deductible “minimum amount” translation if you have 1000 deductible, you are only getting $1000. Fourth: Must give copy of police report within 7 days (Like they’re ever going to move that fast for anything but a donut sale). Fifth: If they take your lock with them, don’t count on payment. Blatantly misleading advertising, don’t fall for it or count on it. For these reasons alone, I give it 0 stars regardless of how well/poor it performs. Truth in advertising people!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WORTHLESS SEE PICS!!! WILL NOT STOP THEIVES!
customer_reviews.text: See the pictures, my motorcycle was stolen and this did nothing to stop it.
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Got cut right through
customer_reviews.text: I know bike theft is bad in urban areas, especially places like NYC, and I suspected it was similar in SF, but this lock didn’t last a month. Too heavy to bring with you, so if the idea is long term protection, it ought to hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan VanDyke

customer_reviews.title: Lock broke in within 4 weeks
customer_reviews.text: Just after 2 weeks of using it, i noticed that the lock was getting harder and harder to open...i put some oil on it...yesterday i had my morotcycle parked and locked and when trying to get it, the lock just would not open...after almos 20 min i finally could open it and unchain my motorcycle...i will not use it again bc clearly i may not be able to unlock my motorcycle next time. now i have a 150$ chain and lock that i cannot use. it is the second time this happens to me with this brand locks.
customer_reviews.author: Jose Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: Does not reliably open
customer_reviews.text: Many times the key does not fully rotate within the lock- so won't open. Other times the key does rotate fully so should unlock...but I, my husband, helpful passerbyers can't pull the lock apart because it didn't actually unlock. So this is not a reliable lock. I wish it were!
customer_reviews.author: Mv

customer_reviews.title: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link...
customer_reviews.text: The chain itself is very strong and secure, but thieves can just cut the u-lock. I would recommend a much lighter chain since it’s not the failure point.
customer_reviews.author: Erik Goldman

customer_reviews.title: Lock failed after three or four uses.
customer_reviews.text: Bad news. I used this lock and chain 3 or 4 times to secure my motorcycle. I unlocked it yesterday to move the bike, but now the key has no effect on the two internal locking lugs. I can't re-lock the thing. Expensive paperweight.
customer_reviews.author: Dale L. Housley

customer_reviews.title: Bad Mo Fo
customer_reviews.text: This chain and lock is no joke. Heavy and practically screams F off! Bought it to secure my new scooter. I'm glad I goth this length and not the shorter 3' one.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Great for a motorcycle but too big for a bicycle..
customer_reviews.text: This chain can definitely protect you from thieves... as well as tanks and artillery. This thing is a beast! I think this chain would work best with my motorcycle rather than my bicycle. This chain is much bigger than I expected and barely fits between the spokes on my bicycle wheels. Its also quite unwieldy and troublesome to use with something so lightweight. If you are looking for a great chain to lock your motorcycle, then this is for you. If you are looking for something for a bicycle, then go for the Kryptonite Evolution 4 chain. Its much lighter and easier to use with a bicycle.
customer_reviews.author: JD Law

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely do not buy if you're doing it for the anti-theft protection
customer_reviews.text: If you're planning on buying this because of the anti-theft protection offer the manufacturer has, DO NOT!!! I chose this brand because of their program and I simply couldn't register to it. After you fill out the forms and submit, the page stops loading. I've tried multiple browsers in multiple devices but that's what it is. Kryptonite's customer service is awful, takes forever to reply and doesn't resolve anything, giving generic (not to say stupid) solutions to your problem. Just to be clear, I'm not talking about the quality of the product, that is okay.
customer_reviews.author: Flávia

customer_reviews.title: It's worth it just to frustrate thieves.
customer_reviews.text: This chain and lock was the only protection between over three thousand dollars of bicycles and a bike thief with a pair of bolt cutters. The end result was the attached photo- there were a few cuts to the plastic coating without any real damage to the lock itself. The bikes were left unharmed. A neighbor who had locked up his bikes with a simple cable lock wasn't so lucky. This lock is extremely heavy and it can damage the paint job to your bike if you're not careful. Other than those caveats, this is perfect for garages in high theft areas.
customer_reviews.author: Greg M.

customer_reviews.title: Great lock.1 year $5000 theft protection bicycle or $2000 powersports,  (description states $3750 and $3000, both are wrong)
customer_reviews.text: Seems sturdy. It comes with a key replacement warranty and a theft protection compensation, which are nice. I don't like it that the description here on Amazon is inaccurate about the theft protection. It's valid for only one year and the amount is $2000 for powersports or $5000 for a bicycle. Make sure to register on Kryptonite's web site.
customer_reviews.author: Flaxman

customer_reviews.title: JUNK lock Please read me before you buy this.
customer_reviews.text: It's hard to write this. I bought this chain and lock for piece of mind for locking up our motorcycles when out riding. The very first time I locked them overnight I could not unlock it. We tried for over 2 hours and I had all 3 keys that came with it. Now our motorcycles are locked and we are stuck. What a hassle to get a wrecker company to come and cut that lock off. I am very mad it cost $150.00 to have a wrecker cut that lock-off for us. Like I said nice chain I went and bought a tried and true Master lock same type and it will be working for years to com
customer_reviews.author: R. T. Swisher

customer_reviews.title: Lock sticks
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely gentle with key and lock cylinder, after reading a few negative reviews about the lock jamming. Mine did on about the 10th use. Key only turns partially, shackle will not release. Have used lots of WD40 and jiggling of key and shackle with no release of jammed lock.
customer_reviews.author: celia

customer_reviews.title: my favorite heavy lock.
customer_reviews.text: I own 2 of these. Have one Purchased in california in 1990. Purchased a second one in 2017 after purchasing a new bike with updated lock because original lock was misplaced.This chain and lock I believe could never be broken, or stolen. The only downside to this lock is its weight.This lock can also serve as a weapon, if you hit somebody with this chain in the head they will die.If you want serious security get this.Also another bonus Kryptonite is a division of schlage lock co. The customer service is superior online and on phone.But very heavy.
customer_reviews.author: rob

customer_reviews.title: My bike has not yet been stolen.
customer_reviews.text: I do not know how much of my lack-of-victimhood is due to the lock, or that I stow my bike inside my apartment and the fact that I don't frequent many places, however every time I've locked my bike up somewhere with this chain (and another loop for the front wheel and seat), all the components have still been present upon my return. Take that as you will. This would be a 4-star review, however an acquaintance of mine spoke highly of the assurance of recompense that Kryptonite offers, having experienced it herself. I have, therefore, added a 5th star on her behalf.
customer_reviews.author: xizar

customer_reviews.title: Lock jammed after 2 months of use
customer_reviews.text: The keys stopped working in this lock after 2 months of using, or ~30 times of unlocking. The key barely fits in and struggles to turn. When it does turn, the lock doesn't engage. The seller (Mass Depot) won't take responsibility and is making me go through the manufacture.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Harris

customer_reviews.title: Wow..
customer_reviews.text: This lock is a beast! Even the lock is a beast! My girlfriend has had 4 bikes stolen so this was my last resort! It looks like this may be a solution to the problem. If they get through this then they had to work for it and they can have the bike.lol Even the key has light on it so if you are unlocking at night you can see....People who see it just stare in amazement. pretty funny to see their reactions...
customer_reviews.author: RonBurgundy

customer_reviews.title: Dont plan on taking this for long rides.
customer_reviews.text: I like to do everything to the extreme, but this was a mistake. It is impossible to affix to a bike for transport. You need a bag or basket to transport this lock without a huge headache. With that being said. Holy smokes this is a heavy duty unit. Would be great for locking a bike in a garage, or maybe using it to tow an 18 wheeler out of a ditch.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Maris

customer_reviews.title: Lock Mechanism Sticks. Not Very Secure!
customer_reviews.text: Lock mechanism sticks! Tried for hours and would not open! Read reviews! This happens frequently! Had to pay $125 to get someone to remove for me. He got it off in about 2 minutes! Total waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Prometheus

customer_reviews.title: They say it can’t be done, but this thing can be cut and stolen—take it from me.
customer_reviews.text: 10 out of 10 for theft? Left this thing locked to a light pole while I was out of town for a few days. Kept my bike in a buddy’s garage (glad I did). Came back today because I needed to lock my bike up in another part of the city and it was gone. Tried calling kryptonite’s customer service, but there is none. You leave a message on a voicemail, and we all know how that stuff goes. Super bummed out. If I wanted my stuff stolen, I’d have picked up a cheap POS padlock. Now I’m out 120 bucks and have to keep my bike garaged until I can figure something out.
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Barna

customer_reviews.title: No chain or lock is 100%
customer_reviews.text: Sadly my $8000 bike was stolen while using this chain and lock to lock it to my car. Thankfully my renter’s insurance covered it minus the $500 deductible. My insurance company was awesome. The lock— obviously not.
customer_reviews.author: Velocity Girl

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty - and I mean heavy!
customer_reviews.text: I already have a OnGuard 8019L Mastiff 6' x 3/8" Quad Chain Lock and I thought to buy something a bit different for the wife's bike just to keep the locks and keys different. This thing while more expensive is a heavier duty (at least the chain is) system, and as such weighs more. I ended up swapping out with the wife so she wouldn't have to deal with the weight. Truthfully this is probably overkill for a mountain bike and is more suitable to a Harley or such. I'd have given it 5 stars based on quality alone, but the application in my case drops it down a peg due to the overall weight.
customer_reviews.author: K. E. Mac Conley

customer_reviews.title: The real deal
customer_reviews.text: In recent months, I've taken measures to protect my bike against theft or tampering. I bought special screws so my quick release parts are harder to remove. I also bought an alarm and GPS device that connects to my phone to alert me if my bike is being moved. This is just the icing on the cake. This chain and lock are heavy duty. I think it's fair to say that a thief is very likely to move on to the next target with this massive chain draped around it.
customer_reviews.author: Boogie Down Kid

customer_reviews.title: Motorcyclist Perspective
customer_reviews.text: I just had my bike stolen from me and when I got another one I wanted it to be secure. I got the chain and it was heavy and feels really tough. It doesn’t look like you can use any type of bolt cutters for this, the only issue I have with it is the lock not the chain. The lock looks like you can cut through it easier than the chain so I’m not sure how secure it is but Ill definitely intimidated people trying to steal your bike so it gets the job done
customer_reviews.author: Omar

customer_reviews.title: You gotta want it bad to break this
customer_reviews.text: I have a community garage where my two E-Bikes are stored. Even under black covers, they can be tempting to someone who knows what they are looking at. To keep them put this lock makes the loss of them nearly impossible. Just trying to get this off the bike would ruin the bike in the process. Warning - this thing is HEAVY - not portable, not meant to be. I see this as something a Harley rider would want. Pricy but you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Will Robertson

customer_reviews.title: I had this on the bike for a week when ...
customer_reviews.text: I had this on the bike for a week when I went to take it off it would not unlock. I kept fighting with the key and wiggling it around for close to 10 minutes before it finally unlocked. I won't use it again in fear of my bike being locked up and me having to take a grinder to it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby W.

customer_reviews.title: Heavy but ridiculously strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had the need to lock up things for decades... tools, freight boxes, and even my personal, little bikes. It would take a considerable amount of time and noise to cut this. Plus the warranty is great. You need to load up receipt of your bike/cycle as well as an image of it to register the lock but they will either pay your insurance deductible or pay up to $5k for the unit that was stolen. BUT it's heavy. Even around your neck it's pretty cumbersome. But security will not be an issue in a public place, that's for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Tim G.

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Security Lock & Chain
customer_reviews.text: I now own two of these locks and chains. I've used one of them for three years now with which I secure my Golf Cart. There is a lot of theft where I live and I've not had any problems with someone trying to cut this chain. I believe it is impossible. Just bought my second second one to secure my adult tricycle. No problems with theft at all. I highly recommend this lock & chain dynamic duo.
customer_reviews.author: Bet

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT!!!! PURCHASE THIS LOCK
customer_reviews.text: I would say that I deserved this appalling experience because I should have read ALL the individual reviews and not just the overall 4stars, especially at this price point. People, IF YOU VALUE YOUR RIDE, again DO NOT PURCHASE THIS ITEM.
customer_reviews.author: Elkins Duval Taveras

customer_reviews.title: Totally Manhattan-proof
customer_reviews.text: I literally can't tell you how many times I've left my apartment in New York to find pieces of my lock scattered on the sidewalk and my bicycle missing. Ain't happening with this. With this thing, you could lock up a motorcycle and never worry. I will say it's HEAVY, but it's a small price to pay for knowing your bike will be there in the morning. I love it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W.

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Wow! The new lock wouldn't even open with the keys provided...cylinder frozen on arrival. Luckily, the seller refunded the return. I ended up going with a Schlage 12mm Cinch Ring Security Chain w/a Stanley Hardware S828-160 CD8820 Shrouded Hardened Steel Padlock. This combination is cheaper and perfect for locking my mtn bike on a roof rack and in a garage during storage.
customer_reviews.author: lilmtnwolf

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid Locks
customer_reviews.text: I use these to store a Polaris General outside at my lake community. I use two of these to secure front and back tires to the frame. These are super heavy duty and would take a thief quite a while to defeat. I'm sure with enough time and resources, someone could work their way through these (see YouTube) but they're definitely big enough to scare off the semi/unprepared thief. They won't make an easy day for them. The only true 100% theft fix is insurance. This is the next best thing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazing Rando

customer_reviews.title: Returned.  Good God what a chain.  You could pull stumps with this thing.
customer_reviews.text: Never seen such a heavy duty chain unless it was one attached to a tractor or ship's anchor. Could barely lift it. It will most certainly protect your bike from thieves provided if it doesn't bend your bike's frame. Way to go Kryptonite, the bullet proof chain from Hades. Had to return it - couldn't believe it was made to secure a bicycle. New York Fahgettaboudit indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Bernard Franklin Tant III

customer_reviews.title: So intimidating, no one will even try to wrangle with this chain/lock
customer_reviews.text: I laughed out loud when I opened the box. IT IS BIG & HEAVY. This is not a chain you will take with you on a ride, but it is the pinnacle of bicycle security. You will sleep soundly with this chain/lock on your bike. We use it to lock 2 bikes to each other and to a 4" bike rack in a high theft area. (Each bike is also locked independently to the rack with Kryptonite New York U locks.) Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: luvamazon

customer_reviews.title: Superman's chain!!
customer_reviews.text: You want heavy duty??? Well look no further!!! This Kryptonite would even be a tough match against Superman! Well except for an angle grinder. Cause that is how your chain is going to come off... without a key. I use this to lock up my 05 GSXR 600 at my apartment. I also use Kryptonite's disk lock with a Dowcow motorcycle cover to creat layers of security. Also register your key or keys (if you have another Kryptonite product) on their website in case you lose a key. They will send you a replacement for a $10-$15 cost (around there). Don't forget to register your bicycle or powersport. Kryptonite granted me up to $2100 were my motorcycle to get stolen.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Can't Unlock/Lock Reliably
customer_reviews.text: The chain itself is sturdy. However, the keys that came with the lock are flimsy at best. Sometimes it takes me a half an hour to lock/unlock the thing because the keys don't fit into the lock properly.
customer_reviews.author: Janene Vesper

customer_reviews.title: Takes 30 tries to open lock with key
customer_reviews.text: The chain is great but the lock is TERRIBLE. I spend on average 5 entire minutes wrestling with the lock for it to open, and look like I'm trying to steal my own bike. Unreliable and frustrating. Get a better U-lock to go with the chain.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy M.

customer_reviews.title: sturdy and noisy
customer_reviews.text: The chain is heavy, sturdy and noisy, worth the price, but the lock broke after ONLY ONE MONTH of use! I never dropped it and nobody tried to force it. Can't open it anymore because the mechanism locked and I had to call a locksmith ($100). If I spend 50 dollars on a lock, I expect it to be indestructible.
customer_reviews.author: Lorenzo M

customer_reviews.title: Works well so far
customer_reviews.text: Needed for my area since it's outside. No issues so far. I wish the chain was longer since I'm wrapping it around a pole. I have my bike pretty close. I understand the length reasoning but it was a hassle in the beginning. I got my system worked out now so I'm good to go. The lock and chain is dropping and hitting the concrete regularly so it's rather sturdy. I should definitely stop letting it hit the ground so it maintains that sturdiness lol
customer_reviews.author: Simonhawk

customer_reviews.title: Super strong but a little finicky.
customer_reviews.text: This chain and lock is ghee beefiest I have ever seen. My only trouble so far is that my lock got bound up once. The tumblers inside the lock hole got out of alignment and the lock refused to open. I had to carefully take a pick to realign the gates so the key could actuate properly. It has only happened to me once in the month I have owned it, but it was a pretty big scare because cutting the lockor chain would have been unreasonable if the lock had failed internally.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: The Beast
customer_reviews.text: This lock/chain combo is devastating. I purchased it to secure a vintage bicycle that I'm rebuilding. I've had many a velo nicked from me here in SE Florida, but that won't recur with this beast of a security system. Sure, it's really heavy, but I'd rather have a little extra weight than another theft.
customer_reviews.author: Dexter Phalanges

customer_reviews.title: Dont mess around with smaller locks, get the granddaddy
customer_reviews.text: I had two motorcycles stolen, the second of which had a smaller lock on it than this one. If they have the urge to saw through this bad boy, good luck... I have also paired it with the Disc Brake lock so hopefully that will stop any future criminals. Don't mess around with those little locks, I did and paid the price.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Thieves don't even bother.
customer_reviews.text: I ride a keyless Tomos moped with locking forks, still, 2 men could just pick it up, throw it in the back of a pickup truck and be gone to drill that fork lock key hole. Now they don't even bother after they see this beast. The only downfall is I top out at 40mph but when I have the Kryptonite with me I top out at 38mph she's a heavy beast but I love her...almost as much as I love my moped. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Tabi Rexford

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product. Arrived ahead of schedule
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product. Arrived ahead of schedule, as pictured. Bought because I previously had my braided and sheathed 0.5 inch cable clipped off of the u-lock and had my bike stolen. This should be enough to deter most thieves from YOUR bike and send them somewhere else. People have reported difficulty with the locking mechanism. I haven't experienced this at all - but I'd say if you did have any issues just get over it and use a different U-lock. After all it's the chain that I really needed from this thing. It's a total monster!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin verbil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bike security!!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lock for my son’s bike, and it was clearly an excellent security option as it was thick strong metal links and lock. However, at 15+ lbs it was a little bit too heavy for my son to ride with so I decided to return it. This or the Kryptonite u lock (as a lighter option) would both be great security.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkboots

customer_reviews.title: wow
customer_reviews.text: very serious I put a hard file on the chain link and it glided over like it was diamond . not a scratch. very hard and very impressive. Key tumblers are on two angulated axises so bump picking wont work. I pity the your neighbor the next guy to whom the thief turned because of your lock .
customer_reviews.author: Kat & Bear

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Lock and Chain
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lock to secure a generator to our building. It is outside and covered, but I wanted it locked down. Thieves came by two different nights. The first night they fiddled with the lock but then left. They came back 2 nights later with 4 foot long bold cutters. The video showed them cranking down on the bolt cutters for nearly 15 minutes. In the end they left. I checked the chain and lock the next morning and the cloth covering was torn up but the chain didn't even show a scratch from the bold cutters!!! I tell everyone about this lock. It is incredible!
customer_reviews.author: Ben B.

customer_reviews.title: Great chain lock for motorcycle, could be longer.
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for. This is a quality, heavy duty chain lock for your motorcycle. Probably overkill for a bicycle. I use it to chain my motorcycle to a pillar to prevent theft. It does the job and I like that it comes with the $1250 motorsports insurance guarantee included for a year. Lock has a nice feature where it has a plastic tab that slides over the key hole to prevent corrosion or dust to damage the lock. Only gripe is that it is not long enough. Should be 72" long ideally to fit around larger posts.
customer_reviews.author: M. Lam

customer_reviews.title: Don't lose the keys !
customer_reviews.text: This is such a massive lock ,with such weird keys, if you ever lose the keys your bike will be forever chained to where you locked it. You'd need a cutting torch or a carbide saw to remove it, and even with those it'd be difficult. You could chain a Picasso up with this and it'd be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Don B.

customer_reviews.title: like most cities
customer_reviews.text: I live downtown in a big city where, like most cities, bikes are an easy target. I needed something that would take a bigger beating than a u-lock, and something that I could put through one of my tires. Although this lock is pretty heavy, I'm sure it'll stand up to 99.9% of bike thieves. The look of the large chain links alone are a great deterrent. The nylon sleeve it's well connected so it doesn't slip off, however it doesn't come off completely for those of you looking to remove it. Great lock, two keys provided (one with a built in LED light), and a dust cover for the lock itself. Great product and worth the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: The most secure bike lock to be found!
customer_reviews.text: Look this lock and chain is very expensive, but the old phrase, “You get what you pay for!”, was never more true! We all know that any lock can be defeated. The real purpose of a bike lock is to make it too difficult to steal the bike. This lock and chain does that! I watch the “Lock Picking lawyer” on YouTube and he tested this combo. His hydraulic cutter broke. Do I need to say more! Again, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Delagasse

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and not quite long enough
customer_reviews.text: I bought the longest length available and it could use an extra foot or two of length. This chain is HEAVY and challenging to find the right spot to place it on your bike. It looks intimidating for would be thieves, however the ergonomics might be too much for you depending on what area of town you live in.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy but very secure. I wish it were a bit longer to give me more length to wrap around the frame through both tires and around the rack on my car; it would make locking my bike a little quicker. It's very heavy so I currently use it to only lock my bike to the rack on my car when parked while traveling with my bike. I keep it in the back of my car when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: MikeF

customer_reviews.title: Great and effective
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy! Great and effective. I use it only when I'm at home and my bike is in the parking lot since it's really just too heavy to carry in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Hands-down the most stout lock out there!
customer_reviews.text: This lock is awesome... there's a reason it's got the highest ratings of any other lock out there. My ONLY complaint - the tumblers are sort of difficult to align when you're trying to unlock it... not exactly intuitive. I read in another review that you shouldn't force the key if it's not turning - I cannot stress the importance of that enough. If it's not turning [and the key is correct], you've not got all of the tumblers aligned, just keep trying, DON'T FORCE THE KEY.
customer_reviews.author: David Fox

customer_reviews.title: Portable Fort Knox
customer_reviews.text: I use this to secure a trailer when I'm on the ocean. Lock has withstood three summers of marine environment exposure with no signs of deterioration. This summer a short burst of WD-40 kept the key tumbler functioning smoothly. Chain is extremely heavy, and I still own my trailer...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Beast of a lock
customer_reviews.text: This lock is a little heavier than expected. If you need the Arnold of chain locks, this would be it. This was for my wife and her scooter. She is 5" and around 110 lbs. Its hard for her to handle, so I'm sending this one back and ordering a lighter one.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Best I’ve purchased.
customer_reviews.text: Confident this will be difficult to be defeated unless they use a cutting welder. Used for securing a 100lb. Propane tank until ready for use with emergency generator. I purchased 3 of them 2 for use with other things but all will be eventually locked to a ground anchor.
customer_reviews.author: John W.

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: This chain and lock appear to be made with security in mind and appear very strong. Is it foolproof? I doubt it, it's almost impossible to completely secure something without spending millions and even then there's probably a hole. But my idea is that it would slow a thief long enough that my alarm would kick in and notify the local authorities. I doubt that any thief wants to stick around with a high decibel alarm telling anyone within ear shot that something is amiss and that it is likely the police are on the way. So for me it is another solid link in a chain of security. It does what I want.
customer_reviews.author: Wsmall

customer_reviews.title: Saved my bike
customer_reviews.text: Lost the seat but they didn't get the $1300 bike. Looks like they tried hard as well because the wheels were loose but couldn't get them off. Should have had the smaller cable in place as a second security measure and they wouldn't have even got the seat! going to buy one now lol.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Janssen

customer_reviews.title: CRACK 'UP!
customer_reviews.text: You gotta really want it to get thru this chain! Crackheads better bring sone extra crack with them for this job 'cause they gonna be there for a minute, LOL! Everytime i lock up my bike i look at the locks on the other bikes around me and I know mine will be the last one on the rack stolen. It weights about 25lbs, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of mind.
customer_reviews.text: This Kryptonite chain is heavier duty than I thought it would be! The chain is tempered so it is practically bolt cutter proof. I used this chain to lock down my 2005 Honda CBR600RR. I can say that I trust this chain and lock to protect something very dear to me. I no longer have to worry about my bike being stolen. Good luck to anyone who tries.
customer_reviews.author: GP Shorty

customer_reviews.title: Show Me
customer_reviews.text: Show Me ... the guy who cane LIFT this lock, much less lift the property you lock it to. I love it and the tough guy, NYC stuff on it too. Great marketing job. Great workmanship job. Great experience. Priced no less than I would expect. If it were cheaper, I would not trust it. Oh, Irony. We usually like cheaper... but not here, not now.
customer_reviews.author: modbantam

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: Great lock and chain. it is HEAVY, but that is what I was looking for to lock up our dirt bikes. I wish the chain came in a slightly longer size, but since it does not, we will likely be picking up another chain. It has plenty of slack to lock up two dirt bikes together. THe lock is great, too, and it comes with three keys.
customer_reviews.author: N. McDonald

customer_reviews.title: They cut right through it
customer_reviews.text: This saved my motorcycle from getting stolen, but I'm severely disappointed with the fact these can still be cut with a battery-powered angle grinder when I'm not around for a few hours. I'm not sure there is a better alternative, so my rating may not properly reflect this product amongst the competition (if there is any').
customer_reviews.author: Sarrus25

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty lock!
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy (which is the point). I use this on a large electric trike. I lock the frame and wheel together when there's no where to lock it. Since the bike weighs 150 lbs someone would need to be able to pick the whole thing up if they wanted to steal it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: A little too short, a little too thick, but fahgettaboutdit
customer_reviews.text: I like the heavy security of this chain... but surely they could have done something with the geometry so that I could easily fit it between my spokes? It takes like 10 minutes to carefully thread this through my tire so that I don't damage my bike. Also, I've come to the conclusion that 60" really isn't long enough to wrap around everything.
customer_reviews.author: Some Guy Somewhere

customer_reviews.title: Heavy and secure!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy and secure! It says I bought a model 1410 but I received 1415...seem identical. And it looks like it is about as secure as a bike lock can be. Certainly will make most thieves move along when they see it.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walker

customer_reviews.title: Intimidating and good for motorcycles
customer_reviews.text: I live in an apartment and the parking is a problem. There have been thefts of motorcycles around. I use this thing to tie down my motorcycle to a metal pillar and from the looks of it I doubt anyone would try to cut it. It looks intimidating. If anyone tries to cut it they better get gas powered giant cutters, small time thieves gonna regret even trying at it. Its quite heavy and unwieldy, not sure how bicyclists carry it everywhere. Seems more suitable for motorcycles.
customer_reviews.author: amol

customer_reviews.title: This makes it annoying to carry around and snake through your bike frame
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid lock and chain; maybe one of the most secure available. That said, it is really, really thick and heavy. This makes it annoying to carry around and snake through your bike frame. It is worth asking if the extra security is worth the inconvenience of such a large chain.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob S.

customer_reviews.title: Really thick way better then any home depo chian worth the money- that's ...
customer_reviews.text: Really thick way better then any home depo chian worth the money- that's fersher nd i feel way more safe over night with this on knowing that just on site some one will give up even if they put in effort to much time it'll take to cut that it's not worth the risk
customer_reviews.author: Young curious

customer_reviews.title: Burly beast of a lock
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this lock after my and my wife's mountain bikes were stolen off the back of our car. The thief used bolt cutters to cut the cable lock. This lock might be overkill but I am confident that nobody is going to cut it. Watched some YouTube videos of people cutting various types of locks with bolt cutters (including U-locks) and this lock broke the bolt cutters. Sold!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Sandvig

customer_reviews.title: I didn't think I'd ever get a good night's sleep knowing my motorcycle was parked on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Heavy, solid, secure. I didn't think I'd ever get a good night's sleep knowing my motorcycle was parked on the street. Once I got this chain/lock on my bike and a basic cover, I felt at ease. A bolt cutter would do nothing but Mar the metal a little bit. You'd have to spend some time with an angle grinder to break it and that's preposterous. The lock is heavy duty, unpickable* if that's a word, and comes with a LED lit key and two basic spare keys. I'd buy it again if I ever get another motorcycle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Standard for bike security but...
customer_reviews.text: This is great if you're just chaining your bike up when commuting or in a shared bike storage facility. However, it isn't long enough to secure your bike to a bike rack if using a hitch mounted rack or similar. Really needs to be another 12" to 18" in total length.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey N Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Heavy Duty
customer_reviews.text: This chain ain't no joke. It's heavy and ridiculously tough. I feel like my stuff is secure. I'm really happy with it. Only complaint the lock mechanism and key... the keys seem a little flimsy and you have to mess with it a bit to get it all the way into the lock.
customer_reviews.author: rr

customer_reviews.title: One tough mother
customer_reviews.text: Maybe it doesn't need to be said, but this thing is BEEFY. I really wanted a chain to put through my back tire, and this fits the bill perfectly. Anybody trying to get through this (angle grinders excepted) is going to have a miserable time. (One caveat: If you're putting it through a spoked wheel, it's conceivable that the chain could be too fat to fit comfortably through the spokes if they're exceptionally close together. It works fine on my Harley XL1200V, but it takes a little care to weave it through to the other side.)
customer_reviews.author: Rich A.

customer_reviews.title: Super strong, super heavy.
customer_reviews.text: Super strong, super heavy. Good for your at home lock. I use it with my e-trike. Wouldn’t want to lug it around with any regular bike. 10x more effective than an entry level u-lock, but nothing stands up to a grinding wheel still.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Kernbaum

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: But it gets rusty and gets stuck. You’ll need to use something like WD-40 to losen it up.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: You do not ride with this in your backpack.
customer_reviews.text: Definitely, you DO NOT ride with this in your backpack. You leave this at your workplace and you lock it up when you're at work.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sleep with both eyes shut
customer_reviews.text: This bad boy protects my Vespa on the streets of Boston. If you like to sleep with both eyes shut, scrounge up some extra cash and buy this lock (& maybe also a little disk lock-alarm). I do wish that there was an option to purchase the chain separately (because I already own another kryptonite NY lock, but i'll just use both, no complaints here! If you own a scooter and have to lock it up around a metro area, do not buy a chain shorter than this, 5-feet length is perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Awesome lock, but nearly impossible to open if exposed to rain
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty chain. absolutely NOT weatherproof, however. my lock feels like it has rusted on the insides and it is nearly impossible to remove the U-lock from the locking bar. I think I need to use graphite to lubricate the mechanism. Other than that issue, the chain looks so heavy duty, no one has even bothered to try to cut it.
customer_reviews.author: K. Potter

customer_reviews.title: works quite well...
customer_reviews.text: The related anchor Kryptonite 330202 Black 16mm Above Ground Stronghold Anchor, was a pain in the arse to install in concrete, but I must say, it's not going to be ripped out easily! This thing is tough. Combined with a good anchor, I'd hope a would be thief would just pass your valuables up. Don't cheap out on the anchor or lock though (if you buy them separate), else the chain is pointless. All in all, I expect this to keep my valuables in place (for the most part.) If someone manages to get away with them with this in use, then they were smarter and more prepared than I and, whatever (at that point.)
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: LOL THIEVES
customer_reviews.text: I received this lock and I didn't expect the chain to be so big but that's okay though it's a good security lock let me tell you I lock my bike it's an e-bike in Walmart and I don't worry about it at all great lock
customer_reviews.author: Alvin Douglas

customer_reviews.title: Great lock
customer_reviews.text: Really strong and easy to use just make sure u never lose your key and this item came highly recommended to me and i sleep a little better knowing my bike is secure
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Heavy duty
customer_reviews.text: This thing is heavy duty . Locks up my motorcycle to poles really well and the soft fabric jacket protect my rims from getting damaged from the big steel links
customer_reviews.author: Jip

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy heavy heavy. And so sturdy. No one is taking anything that is locked up with this thing. I use it for my $3K e-bike that's kept in the garage of my condo building. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra

customer_reviews.title: This is a very large and heavy motorcycle lock and chain!
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty for sure. Unfortunately, I returned this product immediately because it was far too heavy and cumbersome for my Schwinn Meridian trike, even though it has a large basket in the rear in which to carry it. The links are so large that the chain can only be used to secure the bike frame but not the wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Bigfoot

customer_reviews.title: Helps me feel better about leaving my bike!
customer_reviews.text: These are so awesome! Suuuuuuper heavy but do what they’re made to do. Obviously, no lock is indestructible... but this would take the most determined bike thief in the world to get through!
customer_reviews.author: austin

customer_reviews.title: Very secure
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Super heavy so not necessarily something you want to carry along, but we use it in our condominium parking garage for security.
customer_reviews.author: Byron J. Huff

customer_reviews.title: Easy To Use and Solid
customer_reviews.text: This lock is THICK and STURDY. No one is even going to try to get past this. We use it to hook a dolly to a camper when its in the storage parking lot. We never worry. This was worth the money. Its got a lot of length, its easy to get the lock on and its easy to get the lock back off.
customer_reviews.author: Goos

customer_reviews.title: You could tie bulldozers up with this chain
customer_reviews.text: The first time I showed my dad this chain and lock, he asked if I was going to chain our bulldozer up. I knew this chain was made heavy, but not heavy enough to hold a Boeing 747 down. I got it to make sure that my mountainbikes wouldn't get stolen on vacation. That's not going to be an issue unless someone happens to be hauling around an industrial acetylene torch. I wrapped this chain around my mountain bike frame and went for a ride, I was surprised to find that it did not weigh me down or get in the way. It may be a little overkill for my purposes, but I am beyond satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Zam

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This lock is one heavy duty lock. I can always count on this before someone decides to try to break this chain. I give it a A+.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny N.

customer_reviews.title: Nice Thick/Heavy Chain
customer_reviews.text: This seems to be a really good chain. Very thick, really heavy, the lock is solid too. Definitely a nice anti-theft addition
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: but it seems like a small price to pay for 100% assurance that ...
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for my 49cc scooter, so it's probably overkill for my situation. But whatever you decide to lock down with this device is not going anywhere, anytime soon. It certain does its job as advertised. The only downside for me is that it weighs a ton and takes up a lot of room under my seat, but it seems like a small price to pay for 100% assurance that my scooter would probably be the last thing still parked in just about any situation that doesn't involve a Sawzall!!
customer_reviews.author: Giova

customer_reviews.title: There is a sturdy cloth covering
customer_reviews.text: Compared to other bike locks, this really is in the category of kryptonite. We purchased after having our bikes stolen with the regular cable lock cut off. I don't know that I would keep this on the bikes on the back of the car but we did attach when parked. There is a sturdy cloth covering. but it may not hold up over the long haul. This lock comes with a guarantee against loss so it is well worth the cost, especially when you consider what you paid for your bike.
customer_reviews.author: lothlorien_pyc

customer_reviews.title: Solid item
customer_reviews.text: Item works really well, so far nobody has stolen my bike. Chain is long enough and easy to handle. Lock seems solid.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Caemmerer

customer_reviews.title: Has Lead in it which is not mentioned in the description
customer_reviews.text: This product has lead in it. It says that on the label on the packaging; however it is not mentioned anywhere on the product listing on the website. This is a significant detail that is omitted, and hence this gets a 1-star.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Looks sturdy enough
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it to secure my bike to the rack during road trips. 60" chain fits perfectly. If I put chain under the cables over the bottom bracket, chain is a bit loose.
customer_reviews.author: Max S.

product_meta.title: Kryptonite New York FAHGETTABOUDIT 1415 14mm Chain & New York Lock 15mm Disc Lock
product_meta.description:
14mm six-sided chain links made of 3t HARDENED MANGANESE STEEL for ultimate strength. Durable, protective nylon cover with hook-n-loop fasteners to hold in place. Includes maximum security New York Disc Lock with 15mm MAX-PERFORMANCE STEEL SHACKLE. Patented*, oval hardened STEEL CROSSBAR for extra security. Hardened DOUBLE DEADBOLT locking for extensive holding power. HIGH SECURITY DISC-STYLE CYLINDER with reinforced anti-drill, anti-pull protection system. SLIDING DUSTCOVER protects and extends cylinder life. 3 STAINLESS STEEL KEYS – one lighted with high intensity bulb and replaceable battery. Key Safe Program.Product dimensions: 5’ (150cm) chain length, 15mm shackle diameter.

AMAZON.COM
REVIEW:Rated 11 out of 12 in Kryptonite's 12-point security comparison system, the New York Fahgettaboutit 1415 Chain Bicycle Lock with New York Disc Lock is built for extreme security needs in high crime areas. The longer, five-foot chain provides flexibility if you need to lock multiple bikes together, lock components to your bike, and/or frequently have to anchor to larger objects. Built to prevent any chance of leverage or cutting attacks, the chain is constructed with 14-millimeter, six-sided chain links made of 3t manganese steel to provide the ultimate, strength. The chain is secured to your bike with the New York Disc Lock--designed for total pick, drill, and leverage attack protection with a 15-millimeter hardened MAXPerformance steel shackle and higher security disc-style cylinder. The reinforced anti-drill/pull cylinder protection system is designed with more than one million key variations and a sliding dust cover protects and extends cylinder life. The heavy-duty chain is covered with a durable, protective nylon cover held in place with Hook-n-Loop fasteners to prevent damage to your bike finish. The lock comes with three keys, one that is lighted with a high intensity bulb for convenience after dark. In the off chance that your bike does get nabbed while locked up with the New York Fahgettaboutit, be sure to register for Kryptonite's free $3,750 anti-theft protection coverage.

 



The Fahgettaboutit Lock comes with one lighted key for convenience after dark. Kryptonite 12-Point Security Comparison System:
The Kryptonite security comparison system ranks the varying levels of security offered by their range of locks. The system is designed to help consumers choose the best lock for their needs. The 12-point system begins with (1) being simple, deterrent security and (12) being extreme security. If you live in the suburbs and have a Rottweiler next to your bike or motorcycle, a lock rated a (1) is all you may need. But, if you live in the middle of a city and you want extreme protection--a Kryptonite lock with a rating of 8 to 12 is a better choice. Kryptonite Anti-Theft Protection:
Anti-theft protection from Kryptonite on Series 2 locks provides up to $3,000 dollars of replacement coverage--should your bike be stolen when using your Kryptonite Series 2 lock. In order to validate this service, you must register for anti-theft protection within 15 days of purchasing your lock. All of the information you need to register for the offer is included in the packaging.
feature_bullets: 14mm six-sided chain links made of 3t HARDENED MANGANESE STEEL for ultimate strength
Durable, protective nylon cover with hook-n-loop fasteners to hold in place
Includes maximum security New York Disc Lock with 15mm MAX-PERFORMANCE STEEL SHACKLE
Patented*, oval hardened STEEL CROSSBAR for extra security
Hardened DOUBLE DEADBOLT locking for extensive holding power
HIGH SECURITY DISC-STYLE CYLINDER with reinforced anti-drill, anti-pull protection system
SLIDING DUSTCOVER protects and extends cylinder life
3 STAINLESS STEEL KEYS – one lighted with high intensity bulb and replaceable battery
Product dimensions: 5’ (150cm) chain length, 15mm shackle diameter
